1.text: Balances of deceit are an abomination to Jehovah, And a perfect weight is His delight.

2.text: Pride hath come, and shame cometh, And with the lowly is wisdom.

3.text: The integrity of the upright leadeth them, And the perverseness of the treacherous destroyeth them.

4.text: Wealth profiteth not in a day of wrath, And righteousness delivereth from death.

5.text: The righteousness of the perfect maketh right his way, And by his wickedness doth the wicked fall.

6.text: The righteousness of the upright delivereth them, And in mischief the treacherous are captured.

7.text: In the death of a wicked man, hope perisheth, And the expectation of the iniquitous hath been lost.

8.text: The righteous from distress is drawn out, And the wicked goeth in instead of him.

9.text: With the mouth a hypocrite corrupteth his friend, And by knowledge the righteous are drawn out.

10.text: In the good of the righteous a city exulteth, And in the destruction of the wicked is singing.

11.text: By the blessing of the upright is a city exalted, And by the mouth of the wicked thrown down.

12.text: Whoso is despising his neighbour lacketh heart, And a man of understanding keepeth silence.

13.text: A busybody is revealing secret counsel, And the faithful of spirit is covering the matter.

14.text: Without counsels do a people fall, And deliverance is in a multitude of counsellors.

15.text: Evil one suffereth when he hath been surety for a stranger, And whoso is hating suretyship is confident.

16.text: A gracious woman retaineth honour, And terrible men retain riches.

17.text: A kind man is rewarding his own soul, And the fierce is troubling his own flesh.

18.text: The wicked is getting a lying wage, And whoso is sowing righteousness—a true reward.

19.text: Rightly is righteousness for life, And whoso is pursuing evil—for his own death.

20.text: An abomination to Jehovah are the perverse of heart, And the perfect of the way are His delight.

21.text: Hand to hand, the wicked is not acquitted, And the seed of the righteous hath escaped.

22.text: A ring of gold in the nose of a sow—A fair woman and stubborn of behaviour.

23.text: The desire of the righteous is only good, The hope of the wicked is transgression.

24.text: There is who is scattering, and yet is increased, And who is keeping back from uprightness, only to want.

25.text: A liberal soul is made fat, And whoso is watering, he also is watered.

26.text: Whoso is withholding corn, the people execrate him, And a blessing is for the head of him who is selling.

27.text: Whoso is earnestly seeking good Seeketh a pleasing thing, And whoso is seeking evil—it meeteth him.

28.text: Whoso is confident in his wealth he falleth, And as a leaf, the righteous flourish.

29.text: Whoso is troubling his own house inheriteth wind, And a servant is the fool to the wise of heart.

30.text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, And whoso is taking souls is wise.

31.text: Lo, the righteous in the earth is recompensed, Surely also the wicked and the sinner!
